All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
CollisionChecker
The CollisionChecker class is responsible for checking collisions between entities and game objects.
Door
Door class represents a door object in the game.
Entity
parent class for entities
Entity.DIRECTIONS
 
Flame
Flame class represents a flame object in the game.
Game_Controller
The Game_Controller class is the central control unit for the game logics, responsible for managing game elements, handling user input, and controlling the game loop.
Game_Controller.ACTION
 
Game_Controller.GAMESTATE
 
Game_Panel
extends JPanel and represents the main panel for rendering the game.
GUI_Controller
The GUI_Controller class manages the graphical user interface for the game.
Instr_Menu
The Instr_Menu class represents the instruction menu in the game.
Key
Key class represents a key object in the game.
KeyHandler
The KeyHandler class handles keyboard input for the game.
KeyHandler.KeyACTION
Enumeration representing possible actions for keyboard input.
Level_Menu
The Level_Menu class represents the level selection menu in the game.
Light
Light class represents the lighting effects in the game.
Main
The Main class serves as the entry point for the Game.
Main_Menu
Main_Menu class represents the main menu panel in the game.
ObjSetter
The ObjSetter class is responsible for setting up game objects based on the current game level.
Pause_Menu
Pause_Menu class represents the pause menu panel in the game.
Player
Player class represents the player entity in the game.
Sound
The Sound class handles playing audio clips in a game.
SuperObject
SuperObject class serves as the base class for various objects in the game.
Tile
Tile class represents a tile in the game.
TileManager
TileManager class manages the tiles and the game map.
Tools
The Tools class provides utility methods for handling images and fonts.
UI
The UI class handles user interface components and displays in the game.
Win_Menu
Win_Menu class represents the win menu panel in the game.
